ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: course was enjoyable and Prof Oliver was great. His videos at beginning of course when he was traveling were well put together.
the course is very useful for understanding a bigger picture of global resources.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: nice overview of many topics
small classroom format
the data mining project was the best part of this course. It encourages you to produce your own knowledge, which is awesome.
The best aspect of the course was the data mining exercise.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: videos were well organized. sometimes lectures were disorganized
I think the instructor needs to be more focused on the contents of this course.
Weekly assignments/discussions can be integrated into the course. This would allow students to delve into the material better.
The duration of the final take home exam was insufficient, given the expected length and quality of answers.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: It was effective.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: My interest is in forestry management. It provides a overall picture of the other resources that are closely related to my interest. Thus, it was very interesting course.
The course helps in placing environmental and global issues into context.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: interested in subject matter
I needed to have a bigger picture of the global resources. In other words, I need to have a basic knowledge about the availability of resources on this planet.
To learn about global systems and distribution of resources.
To gain an overall understanding of the current state of various resources, the related environmental issues and potential future consequences.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes and was provided opportunities for in class discussion of topics and real world applications
yes
Yes , it did.
Yes the knowledge gained from this course met my expectations.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: worthwhile and small class is a nice format for discussions
In order to actively engage in discussions and follow the instructor's lectures, you will have to read ALL the readings before the classes.
I would highly recommend this course to students who want a deeper understanding of natural resources and their role in human and economic development
The course is very informative and students will enjoy the content of the material presented in class and for reading.
